metadata.title: 5.7 The Cosine Law
metadata.creator: Thiago
metadata.abstract: This document is for testing purposes only. The material that is presented here should be treated as an example only.

section.name: section11
section.p: 0.97centerjustify The Cosine Law is another method we can use to determine missing side lengths or missing angles within triangles. We use the Law of Cosines to solve triangles that are not right-angled. Such triangles are called oblique triangles. The Law of Cosines is used much more widely than the Law of Sines. Specifically, when we know two sides of a triangle and their included angle, then the Law of Cosines enables us to find the third side.
